basic_information.scholarship_name: Arlene Tsomah Poolaw Belindo Endowed Memorial Scholarship in Counseling Psychology

description: Scholarship Mission: To provide scholarship assistance to 3rd year graduate students within the College of Education & Professional Studies who are student pursuing a degree in Counseling Psychology. Eligibility Requirements Be a third year graduate of Counseling Psychology at the time award is given Preference will be given to a student from an underserved population Please provide supporting documentation to show how you were either previously or currently involved with any of the following organizations: Black Student Association, Asian American Student Association, Hispanic American Student Association, Native American Student Association Selection Process Recipients of the scholarship will be selected by a departmental committee Award Requirements Must be enrolled in the upcoming fall or spring semester to receive award All funds from this scholarship will be distributed during student teaching Attendance at an awards banquet is required for all recipients Recipients must write a thank you letter to the donors of the scholarship

general_criteria.description: Soft requirements that provide additional points/consideration

hard_criteria.description: Hard requirements that must be met to qualify for the scholarship
